stimulus:
In this experiment, you will be presented with 8 scenarios, which you must read carefully.

After reading each scenario, you will be prompted two comprehension questions: a multiple choice question and a brief open answer question. You will be required to answer both questions for every scenario, meaning 16 questions in total.

To begin the experiment, hit the space bar.

response.Explanation: Gesture and facial expression are not in the words, so Olivia is more likely to take the words at face value and believe what Alice has written.
Gesture and facial expression are not in the words, so Jane is more likely to take the words at face value and believe what Catherine has written.
Gesture and facial expression are not in the words, so Jack is more likely to take the words at face value and believe what Anastasia has written.
Puppies are not usually scary or scary-looking, so Julia might think that Margaret is being jokey in a sarcastic kind of way.
The jacket has nothing to do with the job, so Eric might interpret Phillip pointing it out as disrespectful.
Having witnessed the fight between the brothers, David might interpret the statement as a negative rather than a positive comment.
Even though she and Ken haven't spoken, he knows her well enough to believe her statement.
Not so much sarcastis as guarded because of how the break ended compared to how it began.
